title: Migrate Salesforce Files to a Remote Org
overview: A Pipeline is configured with two #Batch Executables to migrate Salesforce Files and their links to a remote org. In the target org, a unique custom field is added to ContentVersion, and the first #Batch migrates ContentVersion records with this field mapped to the source identifier. The second #Batch migrates ContentDocumentLink records where the linked entity is Account, using VLOOKUP (for ContentDocument) and External ID (for Account) to re-establish relationships. For other parent objects, additional #Batch Executables can be configured in the same way—ensuring files remain correctly associated with all related records after migration.
generalUseCase:
Use #Batch to migrate Salesforce Files and their relationships across orgs—first moving ContentVersion records with a unique identifier, then migrating ContentDocumentLink records that reattach those files to their parent records via VLOOKUP and External IDs—so documents remain correctly related after cross-org migrations.
Use VLOOKUP in the Match process to handle target objects whose keys are composed of multiple fields—matching on a combination of values instead of a single field so records with multi-field composite keys can be aligned correctly, for example, junction objects like ContentDocumentLink or PermissionSetAssignment."
